page.title: 19WHY WE CAME TO BRITAIN
page.content: We came to this country unexpectedly from the beautiful country of Uganda. We came from a small town called Tinta which is situated on the bank of river Nile near Lake Victoria. My grandad came from India in 1922 and all but two of his family were born in Uganda. Uganda was first ruled by the British and became independent in 1962. It was then ruled by a Kabaka or African king. When he died President Oboto ruled. He was overthrown by Amin and the army. My dad had his own business and bungalow but Amin told all British Asians to leave Uganda so we came here with nothing in October,1962. We were taken to West Malling and given food and clothing. The British people have helped us a lot and now we have a council house at Harrietsham.
